content:
Hey sorry I haven't been in the chat, have been physically moving apartments recently and haven't had much time. 

I might be missing some context but if you look at a tree, what occurs is your visual reaction to a tree (sight) and your thoughts about how a tree might relate to your life (thinking). Self-realization results in only a reaction to what is seen in this case, which means if you see a tree and think "oh that tree reminds me of my Grandma who died..." that doesn't cause sadness if it usually would. There is no relationship to an imagined identity. Could be friend, Father, Mother, sibling, etc. 

I'm not sure this is necessarily helpful as what I'm responding to is "Reaction: How does it know what to react to"

I'm not sure what this particularly means other than small bit of context available
